Broadcom Limited Company Overview Broadcom Limited © MarketLine Page 3 Company Overview COMPANY OVERVIEW Broadcom Limited (Broadcom) is a developer and supplier of a broad range of complex digital and mixed signal complementary metal oxide semiconductor based devices and analog III­V based products. The company’s other offerings include semiconductors for set­top/cable modem termination system, cable modems, and passive optical network/digital subscriber line, Ethernet network interface controllers, filters and amplifiers, application­specific integrated circuit, wireless connectivity solutions, embedded processors, hard disk drive/solid state drives controllers, data center switches and routers, optical isolation/motion encoders/light emitting diodes, and fiber optic solutions. The company sells its products to a wide variety of OEMs, contract manufacturers, distributors and end customers. It primarily operates across Asia, the Americas and Europe. Broadcom is headquartered in Singapore. The company reported revenues of (US Dollars) US$17,636 million for the fiscal year ended October 2017 (FY2017), an increase of 33.2% over FY2016. The operating profit of the company was US$2,217 million in FY2017, compared to an operating loss of US$532 million in FY2016. The net profit of the company was US$1,692 million in FY2017, compared to a net loss of US$1,739 million in FY2016. The company reported revenues of US$5,327 million for the second quarter ended February 2018, an increase of 10% over the previous quarter. Broadcom Limited Business Description Broadcom Limited © MarketLine Page 4 Business Description BUSINESS DESCRIPTION Broadcom Limited (Broadcom) is a designer, developer and supplier of a range of semiconductors including complex digital and mixed signal complementary metal oxide semiconductor (CMOS) based devices and analog III­V based products. The company’s products and solutions are used in enterprise and data center networking, home connectivity, broadband access, telecommunications equipment, smartphones, data center servers and storage, factory automation, power generation and alternative energy systems, and electronic displays. The company primarily operates in China, the US, Singapore, and other countries. The company operates through four reportable segments aligned with its principal target markets: Wired Infrastructure, Wireless Communications, Enterprise Storage, and Industrial and Other. The company’s Wired Infrastructure segment provides semiconductor solutions for set­top boxes and the digital subscriber line, cable and fiber broadband access markets. The segment also provides a broad set of standard Ethernet switching technology to deliver system­on­chip (SoCs), for high performance compute applications, supplies high speed serializer/deserializer technology integrated into application specific integrated circuits (ASICs). The company also offers transceivers that receive and transmit Ethernet data packets along copper wire or optical fibers. In addition, Broadcom provides optical laser and receiver components to the storage, Ethernet networking, access, metro and long­haul telecommunication markets. In FY2017, the Wired Infrastructure segment reported revenues of US$8,549 million, which accounted for 48.5% of the company's total revenue. Through the Wireless Communication segment, the company offers a variety of radio frequency (RF) semiconductor devices that amplify, and filter, RF signals. The company's portfolio of products includes front end modules (FEMs) that incorporate multiple die into multi­function RF devices; duplexers and multiplexers, which are a combination of a transmit and a receive filter in a single device. The segment’s products are primarily used in smartphones and tablets. In addition to RF devices, the company provides optoelectronic sensors for mobile handset applications. In FY2017, the Wireless Communications segment reported revenues of US$5,404 million, which accounted for 30.6% of the company's total revenue. Broadcom’s Enterprise Storage segment offers products that are designed to enable secure movement of digital data to and from host machines such as servers, personal computers and storage systems to the underlying storage devices including hard disk drives (HDDs) and solid state drives (SSDs). The segment provides read channel­based system on chip (SoCs) and preamplifiers to HDD original equipment manufacturer (OEMs). In addition, the company supplies custom flash controllers to SSD OEMs, and serial attached small computer system interface (SCSI) (SAS) and redundant array of independent disks (RAID) controller and adapter solutions to server and storage system OEMs. Further, the company provides fibre channel host bus adapters which connect servers to fibre channel storage area networks (FCSANs). In FY2017, the Enterprise Storage segment reported revenues of US$2,799 million, which accounted for 15.9% of the company's total revenue. The Industrial and Other segment of the company offers a range of products for the general industrial and automotive markets. It offers optical isolators or optocouplers, which provide electrical insulation and

For industrial motors and robotic motion control, Broadcom offers optical encoders, as well as ICs for the controller and decoder functions. For electronic signs and signals, it supplies light emitting diode (LED) assemblies to support traffic signals, commercial signs and other displays. For industrial networking, the company provides optical transceivers that enable quick and interoperable networking and factory automation. This segment also includes IP licensing business of the company. In FY2017, the Industrial and Other segment reported revenues of US$884 million, which accounted for 5% of the company's total revenue. Geographically, the company classifies its operations into four regions: China, the US, Singapore and Other. In FY2017, China region accounted for 53.7% of the company's total revenues, followed by the US with 7.2%, Singapore with 1.8%, and Other with 37.3%.

Broadcom Limited History Broadcom Limited © MarketLine Page 7 Contracts/Agreements Year: 2016 The company entered into a definitive agreement to acquire Brocade, a leader in Fibre Channel storage area network switching and IP networking, in an all­cash transaction valued at approximately $5.5 billion, plus $0.4 billion of net debt. The acquisition is expected to strengthen Broadcom’s portfolio of enterprise storage and networking solutions serving OEM customers. Acquisitions/Mergers/Takeovers Year: 2016 Broadcom Limited (Broadcom or “the company”) completed its acquisition of Avago pursuant to a scheme of arrangement under Singapore law, in February 2016. As part of the deal, Avago changed its name to Broadcom Limited. Contracts/Agreements Year: 2016 Cypress Semiconductor agreed to acquire Broadcom's Wireless Internet of Things (IoT) business and related assets in an all­cash transaction valued at $550 million. Under the terms of the deal, Cypress will acquire Broadcom's Wi­Fi, Bluetooth and Zigbee IoT product lines and intellectual property, along with its WICED brand and developer ecosystem. Contracts/Agreements Year: 2015 The company entered into a definitive agreement to acquire Broadcom Corporation, a provider of semiconductor solutions for wired and wireless communications for approximately $37 billion, including $17 billion in cash and $20 billion in stock. Acquisitions/Mergers/Takeovers Year: 2015 The company acquired Emulex in an all­cash transaction valued at $606 million. The acquisition is expected to strengthen the company's portfolio serving the enterprise storage end market. New Products/Services Year: 2015

Broadcom Limited SWOT Analysis Broadcom Limited © MarketLine Page 23 SWOT Analysis SWOT ANALYSIS Broadcom Limited (Broadcom) is a developer and global supplier of a broad range of semiconductor devices. The company's strong focus on innovation and research and development (R&D) provides a competitive advantage by enabling it to launch products that effectively enhance revenues and market share. However, intense competition may adversely affect the company's market share and revenues in the coming years. Strength Strong Financial Performance Global Footprint Strong Focus on R&D Weakness Concentrated Customer Base Opportunity Growing LTE Adoption Positive Outlook for Mobile Phones Market Positive Outlook for Semiconductor Market Threat Dependence on Contract Manufacturing and Outsourcing of Supply Chain Short Life Cycles and Rapid Technological Changes Intense Competition Strength Strong Financial Performance Broadcom exhibited an increase in the financial performance in FY2017. Strong financial performance enables the company’s ability to provide higher returns to its shareholders and also increases its ability to allocate adequate funds for future growth initiatives. In FY2017, the company generated revenues of US$17,636 million as compared to US$13,240 million in FY2016, with an annual growth of 33.2% over FY2016. The increase in annual revenue was primarily due to the full year contribution from acquired BRCM products, as well as strong organic year­over­year growth. The company reported an operating income of US$2,217 million as compared to an operating loss of US$532 million in FY2016. The company reported a net income of US$1,692 million in FY2017 as compared to a net loss of US$1,739 million in FY2016. Global Footprint Broadcom has a diversified global presence. The company through its design, technology transfer and manufacturing stages across all geographies is well positioned to serve its customers globally. Broadcom has a number of sales offices located in various countries, with a significant presence in Asia, which is a key center of the worldwide electronics supply chain. Many of the company's customers design products in North America or Europe that are then manufactured in Asia. In addition, the company has regional customer support call centers, where the company addresses customer issues and handle logistics and

24. Broadcom Limited SWOT Analysis Broadcom Limited © MarketLine Page 24 other order fulfillment requirements. In addition, the company witnessed strong growth across all geographic markets. For instance in FY2017, China, Broadcom’s largest geographic market witnessed a growth of 31.7% over FY2016. Furthermore, revenues from the US, Singapore and Other geographies grew by 12.6%, 29.2%, and 40.7%, respectively. The company's widespread footprint reduces its exposure to risks associated with operating in a particular market. It also provides Broadcom with benefits such as cost reductions through economies of scale. In addition, this geographic diversity provides proximity to customers, enabling the development of close relationships. Strong Focus on R&D Broadcom is committed to continuous investment in product development, with a focus on introducing new, proprietary products. The company’s research and development (R&D) efforts allowed it to develop several innovative products, which provided it with significant competitive advantages in certain target markets. Broadcom has a history of developing innovative technologies. Strong focus on R&D has allowed the company to develop innovative, sustainable and higher value product platforms which provided significant competitive advantages over its peers. In addition, continuous introduction of products allowed Broadcom to build strong reputation in the market. As of October 2017, Broadcom had 24,250 US and other patents and 2,061 US and other pending patent applications. It is working on approximately 150 new patent applications per year, related to a wide range of ASIC, isolation, encoder, LED, RF and optoelectronic components, enterprise storage products, HDD silicon, PCIe, USB and other standard I/O devices, Ethernet and Fibre­Channel connectivity and controllers, set­top box SoCs, cable modem SoCs, broadband access SoCs, wireless connectivity SoCs, switching/routing SoCs, high performance processor SoCs and associated applications. Continued innovation and reputation will allow the company to earn attractive margins by developing high value­add products. Weakness Concentrated Customer Base The company has highly concentrated customer base. It is dependent on reasonably small number of direct customers, OEMs, contract manufacturers and distributors for a majority of its business, revenue and results of operations. The customer concentration increases the risk of quarterly fluctuations in the operating results and sensitivity to any material, adverse developments experienced by the company's significant customers. Recent Developments U.S. 2017 Tax Reform Act On December 20, 2017, the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act, or the 2017 Tax Reform Act, was approved by Congress and is pending presidential approval. In general, the 2017 Tax Reform Act reduces the U.S. corporate income tax rate from 35% to 21%, effective in 2018. The 2017 Tax Reform Act moves from worldwide business taxation to a participation exemption regime. The 2017 Tax Reform Act also imposes base­erosion prevention measures on non­U.S. earnings of U.S. entities, as well as a one­time mandatory deemed repatriation tax on accumulated non­U.S. earnings of U.S. entities. The base­erosion prevention measures will have the effect of subjecting non­U.S. earnings of U.S. entities to taxation in the United States at an effective rate that is expected to be substantially lower than 21%.
